name: Product Management
description: Product Management across these episodes centers on how to choose the right problems, design coherent strategies, and execute in ambiguous, fast-changing environments—especially as AI reshapes what products are and how they improve over time. It addresses how PMs align teams around a narrative and metrics, balance user value with business and responsibility, and build operating systems (experimentation, onboarding, iteration loops) that reliably turn insight into outcomes.
subtopics: Product strategy as integrated choices: where to play, how to win, and what tradeoffs to accept
Execution under ambiguity: prioritization, decision quality, and operating cadence (reflection, iteration, experimentation)
Onboarding and activation as product levers: aligning brand promise with first-use experience
AI product management: non-determinism, evaluation, post-training loops, and the agency/control trade-off
Cross-functional leadership: aligning design/engineering/data/marketing, handling disagreement, and building high-talent teams
Responsible product building: balancing growth with long-term trust, governance, and societal impact
common_frameworks: Strategy as a set of choices (where to play / how to win) tied to explicit tradeoffs
North-star narrative framing (old game → new game) to align product, GTM, and org decisions
Onboarding/activation funnel thinking (promise → first value → habit), with onboarding treated as a universal, underleveraged lever
Experimentation systems: hypothesis → test → measurement, with guardrails to avoid short-term local optima
AI product lifecycle loops: prototype fast → evaluate rigorously → iterate with humans-in-the-loop → post-deploy learning (post-training/reward design)
Decision-quality practices: separate environment constraints from skill gaps; do “understand work” before solutioning; structured reflection to compound judgment
